markdown.markdown:
```{r global_options, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, 
                      error = FALSE)
```

This can't be right, can it? A PhD student can't have a post-doc, right? Well, formally not, but in practice this can happen as well. My colleague Peter is an allrounded field biologist, who is specialised in botany and wants to understand where plants have been, where they are and where they might be in the future. 
... generation, which had to use gazilion tools (GIS, SPSS, Maxent, SDMtools, etc.) to do research. He found out about R and participated in a workshop of how to do everything within R. He came back with a script that was so "messy" and overcomplicated, that he could replicate anything on his own data. And that's where I was able to help him ...
